FuncDef:
The op-field command configures a filter criterion for telemetry sampling.
The undo op-field command restores the default configuration.
By default, no filter criterion is configured for telemetry sampling.
CLIs: op-field <field> op-type { eq | gt | ge | lt | le } op-value <value>
undo op-field <field> op-type { eq | gt | ge | lt | le } op-value <value>

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the field for filtering sampled data.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters.
The field that can be specified is a unit32 node in the YANG model corresponding to the sampling path.

Specifies an operator.
The value is a character string, which can be:
eq: equal toge: greater than or equal togt: greater thanle: less than or equal tolt: less than

Specifies a value involved in filter criterion operation.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.
The value range is the same as that defined in the YANG model for the field option.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a filter criterion for telemetry sampling, run the op-field command. After the command is run, the data that meets the filter criterion can be collected and reported.
Prerequisites
A filter has been created using the filter command.
Precautions
A maximum of two filter criteria can be configured for a filter.
